edge: Pritam composed the soundtrack for Ludo, marking their fifth collaboration with director Anurag Basu.
Director Anurag Basu wrote the script for Ludo without organic song placements and later incorporated songs in the screenplay.
The song 'Hardum Humdum' was originally composed for the sequel of Life in a... Metro, but was later used in Ludo when the sequel did not materialize.
The soundtrack album to Ludo features four original compositions by Pritam.

node_2: three alternates of the original tracks
edge: In addition to the four original tunes, the soundtrack album for Ludo includes three alternate versions of those songs.
The lyrics for some of the songs in the Ludo soundtrack were written by Sayeed Quadri.
Other song lyrics on the album were penned by Sandeep Shrivastava.
Additionally, some of the songs have lyrics written by Shloke Lal.
Other song lyrics on the album were penned by Swanand Kirkire.
The producer of Ludo, Bhushan Kumar, promoted the soundtrack as an album due to a lack of exposure for albums from digitally released films.
The tracks 'Aabaad Barbaad' from the album have been chartbusters and received a positive response from both critics and audiences.
